name: nytimes
text:
Xin Xing the giant panda, whose name means “new star” in Mandarin, died earlier this month at the age of 38 (the equivalent of at least 110 in human years). 

She was the world’s oldest panda in captivity and the star of China’s Chongqing Zoo. https://t.co/XWsoYoWOTu

name: nytimes
text:
Xin Xing was known for outpacing other pandas with her seemingly bottomless stomach — putting away 70 pounds of bamboo shoots, leaves and fruit daily.

“When she was younger, she ate faster and much more than other pandas,” her caretaker of 28 years said. https://t.co/qjR4ehbaqQ

name: nytimes
text:
In North America’s major sports leagues in the 1990s, players were mostly people of color, but the coaches, managers and team owners were nearly all white.

A current snapshot looks mostly the same. https://t.co/LfAsM3SJfa https://t.co/KLM3Q8Pqh6

name: nytimes
text: The NFL once had as many as eight nonwhite head coaches: That number was half that at the beginning of this season, meaning 13% of the league’s head coaches were people of color — 74% of its players were. https://t.co/LfAsM3SJfa https://t.co/KTT3CUoW75

name: nytimes
text:
The WNBA also had a large disparity between the percentage of players and head coaches who were nonwhite.

But 25% of the league’s head coaches were Black, compared with 13.4% of the U.S. population — the best mark among the leagues we analyzed. https://t.co/LfAsM3SJfa https://t.co/NC31Ue5Ypl

name: nytimes
text: Major League Soccer had a higher share of head coaches who are people of color than any of the leagues we studied: 41% in 2020. It also had the smallest disparity between head coaches and players of color. Its players are among the most diverse. https://t.co/LfAsM3SJfa https://t.co/hv8dAAdBB2

name: nytimes
text:
The NBA, similar to the WNBA, has a share of Black head coaches (23%) that outpaces their share of the U.S. population (13.4%).

But as of July, about 30% of NBA head coaches identified as people of color, while 83% of players identified as nonwhite. https://t.co/LfAsM3SJfa https://t.co/T2uLSf1tNI

name: nytimes
text: Major League Baseball is by far the whitest of the sports surveyed. It has the smallest share of players (40%) and the second smallest share of managers (20%) who identified as people of color as of January 2020. https://t.co/LfAsM3SJfa https://t.co/9gppH3UeZ5

name: nytimes
text:
Many U.S. pro leagues have made declarations co-opting the causes of their athletes, namely pledging to combat systemic racial injustices. But these leagues have mostly shown little progress in diversifying their leaders. 

See more of our analysis here.
https://t.co/p6CQYmujpd
